function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Trusting online information sources can give birth to unfounded worries about personal health, specifically during the COVID-19 pandemic.","Impact":"Increased anxiety and unfounded worries about personal health.","Mitigation":"Promoting media literacy and critical evaluation of online information sources.","Technologies":"Educational campaigns, fact-checking tools, and digital literacy programs.","People":"General public, internet users.","Owner":"Government, educational institutions, media organizations."},{"Description":"Information overload increases COVID-19 related cyberchondria.","Impact":"Increased anxiety and health-related decision-making influenced by excessive online information seeking.","Mitigation":"Providing clear and concise information, implementing digital mental health support services, and promoting balanced media consumption.","Technologies":"Digital mental health apps, information filtering tools, and content moderation algorithms.","People":"Online news readers, social media users.","Owner":"Health organizations, tech companies, and mental health professionals."},{"Description":"Perceived severity of the COVID-19 pandemic is a significant predictor for self-isolation intention.","Impact":"Influencing individuals' decisions related to self-isolation and preventive measures against COVID-19.","Mitigation":"Promoting accurate risk perception and public health communication strategies emphasizing the severity of the pandemic.","Technologies":"Public health messaging platforms, risk communication tools, and behavior change apps.","People":"General public, individuals at risk of COVID-19 infection.","Owner":"Public health agencies, government authorities, and community organizations."}]}
